title: Share Your Internet Connection on Windows XP

steps.title: Open the Control Panel.
steps.content: Open the Control Panel. You'll find it in the Start menu.

steps.title: Right-click the connection that you use to connect to the Internet.
steps.content: Right-click the connection that you use to connect to the Internet. For example, if you connect to the Internet by using a modem, right-click the connection that you want under Dial-up.

steps.title: Check the first box under "Internet Connection Sharing."
steps.content: Check the first box under "Internet Connection Sharing." Under Internet Connection Sharing, select the "Allow other network users to connect through this computer's Internet connection" box.

steps.title: If you're sharing a dial-up connection, check the next box.
steps.content: If you're sharing a dial-up connection, check the next box. Select the "Establish a dial-up connection whenever a computer on my network attempts to access the Internet" if you want to permit your computer to automatically connect to the internet.

steps.title: Click OK and then Yes to confirm.
steps.content: Click OK and then Yes to confirm.

steps.title: Open the Control Panel.
steps.content: Open the Control Panel. You'll find it in the Start menu.

steps.title: Right-click "Local Area Connection" and select Properties.
steps.content: Right-click "Local Area Connection" and select Properties .

steps.title: Select "Obtain an IP address automatically" and click OK.
steps.content: Select "Obtain an IP address automatically" and click OK .

steps.title: Open your browser to check, if what you did works.
steps.content: Open your browser to check, if what you did works.
